a.title: Return to the homepage on the district site.

h1.span: Facilities Closed During State-Wide Stay at Home Order

div.p: Due to the statewide stay at home order issued by Governor Parsons today, all facilities will be closed starting Monday, April 6th through Friday, May 1st or until the Governor's office lifts the order.

Food service will still run deliveries, but all other services - Chromebook pickup, Chromebook repairs, students picking up items or returning school property - are all suspended until the order is lifted.
We appreciate your understanding and will keep you apprised of any new information or directions as they come available.

a.aria-label: Go to comments for Facilities Closed During State-Wide Stay at Home Order

div.p: We understand things happen while you're working at home. To get maintenance for a student's Chomebook, follow the process below:
div.div: 1. Parents or students put in tickets to the email address setup:
Please leave student name, parent name, contact email or phone number on the ticket and problem that is occuring.

2. Drop offs at HIGH SCHOOL ONLY on Tuesday and Friday 7am - 2:30pm, so we can honor the 2 day quarantine period suggested by the health department. We would put 2 buckets right inside the front door (hallway area) of HS office with the secretary. 1-Repaired(Outgoing) 1-Damaged(Incoming).
3. We will send email/call parents to let them know repair is occurring.

div.strong: Replacements for damaged or lost chargers will need to be purchased by guardians or families from the school. Negligent damage to Chromebooks or lost Chromebooks will be charged to guardians or families as well.
Replacement chargers for Grades 3-6 cost $18.00. Total Chromebook replacement cost is $320 should there be significant negligence, destruction, or loss of Chromebook.

div.div: Standard repair fees for students in Grades 7-12 still apply.
*High school students who can drive may submit tickets on their own behalf.
**This link is for students/parents ONLY, staff should still utilize the internal helpdesk system.

a.aria-label: Go to comments for Chromebook Maintenance

div.p: Hello! Throughout this period in which we are utilizing Alternative Methods of Instruction, teachers will be available as resources. Please utilize office hours each teacher has posted for direct communication.

a.aria-label: Go to comments for Staff Office Hours During AMI

div.p: Click here for an up-to-date document containing answers to frequently asked questions regarding alternative methods of instruction.

a.aria-label: Go to comments for AMI FAQs for Parents/Students

h1.span: WCSD Digital Learning Resource Guide - For Families

div.p: To aid in accessing content assigned by teachers, here is a Learning Resource Guide.
This may be updated as more resources are identified or utilized throughout AMI.

a.aria-label: Go to comments for WCSD Digital Learning Resource Guide - For Families

div.p: To view, the district letter sent on Friday, March 13 click HERE

Missouri Department of Health and Senior Services (DHSS) Website and Hotline: DHSS's COVID-19 webpage contains any and all COVID-19-related information for Missourians, and is updated frequently. DESE officials remain in close communication with colleagues at DHSS to stay informed about COVID-19 and the current situation in Missouri. DHSS has activated a statewide public hotline - 877-435-8411 - for citizens or providers needing guidance regarding COVID-19. It is operated by medical professionals and is available 24 hours a day, 7 days a week.​​
